words.definition: An abbey is a house or group of houses where monks or nuns live.
words.example: When the monks returned to the abbey, they went straight to prayers.

words.definition: If something is abundant, then it is available in large quantities.
words.example: Cakes, cookies, and candy were abundant at the birthday party.

words.definition: To adjoin something means to be next to or attached to something else.
words.example: She can listen to her brother's conversations because her room adjoins his.

words.definition: If something is ample, then it is more than enough or large.
words.example: There was ample room in the back of the car for our bags.

words.definition: If a place is arid, then it is hot and dry and gets very little rain.
words.example: Not many plants can grow in the arid desert.

words.definition: A cathedral is an important and often large Christian church.
words.example: The cathedral is famous for its beautiful stained glass windows.

words.definition: To deprive someone of something means to not let them have it.
words.example: Because the child was bad, she was deprived of her favorite toy.

words.definition: A drought is a long period of time in which little or no rain falls.
words.example: After three months of drought, the farmers and animals were very thirsty.

words.definition: If someone is eligible, then they are permitted to do or have something.
words.example: Only people who are over 18 are eligible to vote.

words.definition: To fast means to go without food or drink for a period of time.
words.example: In many religions, people fast at certain times of the year.

words.definition: To grumble means to complain in a low voice.
words.example: The students grumbled about having to do extra homework.

words.definition: If something is inland, it is in the interior of a country.
words.example: The bird can fly far inland, away from the ocean.

words.definition: Moisture is a small amount of water in the air or on a surface.
words.example: If you do not dry your feet, any moisture will make your socks wet.

words.definition: Nonetheless is used when something happens despite what was said.
words.example: It was raining; nonetheless, they went for a walk.

words.definition: An oath is a formal, often legal, promise to do something.
words.example: The witness took an oath to tell the truth in court.

words.definition: A prairie is a large area of flat, grassy land.
words.example: In the 1800s, millions of buffalo lived on the prairies of North America.

words.definition: If something is ragged, then it is old, torn, and in bad condition.
words.example: The homeless man had ragged clothes.

words.definition: If an area of land is rugged, then it is rocky and uneven.
words.example: The rugged mountains were difficult to climb.

words.definition: If something is scarce, then there is not enough of it.
words.example: Food was scarce because of the drought.

words.definition: To speculate means to guess about something or its causes.
words.example: Scientists speculate that life may exist on other planets.
